description.content:
`general`, `group` and `user` configuration.
 - The `group` configuration extends the `general` configuration
 - The `user` configuration extends the `general` and `group` configuration

Inheritance Diagram (`<--` means extends):

```

+---------+                  +-------+                    +------+
| general |                  | group |                    | user |
+---------+                  +-------+                    +------+
 * data
 * groupConfiguration     <-- * data
 * userConfiguration                                   <-- * data
 * staffConfiguration     <-- * staffConfiguration     <-- * staffConfigurations
 * patientConfiguration   <-- * patientConfiguration   <-- * patientConfigurations

```

Permission | Scope | Effect
- | - | -
none | | See your own documents
none | `staff enlistment` | See the documents belonging to the group (and your own documents)
`VIEW_DOCUMENTS` | `global` | See any document
`VIEW_DOCUMENTS:{SCHEMA_NAME}` | `global` | See any document of the specified schema

ReadMode on schema is set to 'allUsers':
Permission | Scope | Effect
- | - | -
none | | See any document

ReadMode on schema is set to 'enlistedInLinkedGroups':
Permission | Scope | Effect
- | - | -
none | `patient enlistment` | See the documents belonging to the group
none | `staff enlistment` | See the documents belonging to the group
`VIEW_DOCUMENTS` | `global` | See any document
`VIEW_DOCUMENTS:{SCHEMA_NAME}` | `global` | See any document of the specified schema
